attributes.action: Ensure that the Special Police Officer who threatened two Christian ministers in Birmingham is fired
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Recently I read in the Telegraph that two Christian ministers had been threatened with arrest (under hate crime legislation) after handing-out Christian leaflets and speaking to a group of 'Asian youths' (quoted from the newspaper).

They were also threatened by the special police officer who warned them against preaching their religion in a Muslim area!  And he also told them that they'd be beaten-up if they return!

The paper didn't mention what denomination the special police officer was.

The response from the police force was that the special police officer involved would be sent for 'communication training'.

Police officers,even special ones are public servants. Where personal religious beliefs interfere with their duty, then they are unfit for purpose and should be fired. The officer should himself be arrested for intimidation.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
